addItem(id, item amount);
^

2 erroes
Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Owner Items
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:7, topic:340599”]ok this is what I get so far:

if(objectID == 8879 && playerRights == 3) { int[] partyHats = { ItemId1, ItemId2, ItemId3, ItemId4, ItemId5, ItemId6 }; for (int i = 0; i < partyHats.length; i++) { addItem(id, item amount); } }

what do i put inside the [] that’s beside the “int”? btw thanks for the help so far[/quote]
this should be all you need. basic if statement with an array and for statement in it. For statements are like if statements, but repeat (basically). Arrays are just basically a group of values set to an integer. Basically it’s saying if object 8879 is clicked and the clicker has playerRights = 3, then it’ll add those items.

Quick explanation of for statements:

for (int i = 0; i < partyHats.length; i++) { addItem(id, item amount); }
This is setting a new int “i” to gets 0, the second part is the criteria, what has to happen for it to repeat. It’s taking the length of partyHats, and repeating if i < partyHats; then it increases i (i++ means i + 1, basically… if you want a cool fact, c++ the programming language was named after a programming joke). and the addItem(id, item amount); is just what happens during that for statement. Sorry for posting this, but I felt the need to explain.

Read full topic
